results.title: The Velveteen rabbit
results.creator_credit: Sudy Dostal and Leonard S. Berman
results.brief_description: This classic story based on the book, “The Velveteen Rabbit” by Margery Williams, is about nursery magic. We learn how a boy’s love and friendship transform a toy rabbit into a real bunny.
results.description: This classic story based on the book, “The Velveteen Rabbit” by Margery Williams, is about nursery magic. We learn how a boy’s love and friendship transform a toy rabbit into a real bunny.

results.title: The Velveteen rabbit
results.creator_credit: Pierre Veck and Billy Budd Films
results.brief_description: A stop-frame animated version of Margery Williams classic children’s tale of a toy rabbit’s longing to become “real”. Through the love of a boy and a little nursery magic his dream comes true. Music from Vivaldi’s “Four Seasons”.
results.description: A stop-frame animated version of Margery Williams classic children’s tale of a toy rabbit’s longing to become “real”. Through the love of a boy and a little nursery magic his dream comes true. Music from Vivaldi’s “Four Seasons”.

results.title: The Velvet claw
results.brief_description: Carnivores consist of 236 species which have evolved over 60 million years. This BBC TV series traces the amazing story of their evolution from the dinosaur era to the present day. Narrated by Derek Jacobi. The video is in seven parts: “The Carnassial connection”, “Sharpening the tooth”. “Strength in numbers”, “The Rich man’s table”, Jacks of all trades”, “Small and deadly”, It’s tough at the top

results.title: The Varnished truth
results.creator_credit: Elly Temelcos, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Elly Temelcos and her two sisters spent hours over the years listening to her father’s stories, about life in the village, the war that tore his country apart and the sorrow of separation.

results.title: The Vanishing street
results.creator_credit: Robert Vas, BFI and Jewish Chronicle
results.brief_description: An intensive study of the Jewish comnmunity of the East End of London, in particular with Hessel Street, a centre of Jewry for the past 100 years which is now being pulled down and rebuilt as a slum clearance operation (1961-62). Poses the question: Will the close-knit nature of the community be able to survive under modern housing conditions in large blocks of impersonal flats.

results.title: The Vanishing forest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Four corners (Television program)”
This film asks whether or not there should be an expansion in the woodchip industry. Using Eden and Coff’s Harbour as examples, the film presents some differing views on the value of woodchipping. A basic conflict over land use is raised and the viewers are left to make up their own minds.

results.title: The Vanishing breed
results.creator_credit: Boris Holtzman and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
Discusses what can be done to preserve the hundreds of species of rare or endangered birds and animals and why they should be protected. Presents wildlife of east Africa as an example of the growing conflict between conservation of wildlife and the demands of farming and industry. Narrated by Norman Rose.

results.title: The Vanishing (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: George Sluizer, Paul Schiff, Larry Brezner and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: After his girl friend mysteriously disappears at a petrol station, Jeff (Kiefer Sutherland) begins a year long quest to find her. Not even a new love (Nancy Travis), can distract him, and after much secrecy he is forced to bring her in on his quest. Unknown to Jeff, he himself is being stalked by the calculating psychopath (Jeff Bridges), responsible for kidnapping his girlfriend in the first place. Jeff and his new girlfriend are led on a chilling reenactment of the fate that occurred a year ago. Cast includes Kiefer Sutherland, Sandra Bullock, Nancy Travis, Park Overall and Maggie Linderman. This is a remake of director Sluizer’s 1988 Dutch version (302156).
